page.title: 18LOOKING AT TYDD ST.GILES
page.content: In Tydd St. Giles the landscape is flat.You can see a long way because the land is so flat.You can see a lot of blue sky because there are no hills to get in the way.In the sky you see a lot of R.A.F. planes training, and helicopters spraying the fields of corn and potatoes. There are no woods or forests to be seen, but there are lots of scattered trees.Many of them are willows and poplars.A lot of willows grow along the edges of the dykes. We have planted a lot of different trees round school. The roads are mainly straight, but very bumpy. This is because the silt and peat underneath is always settling and moving. Along both sides of the roads are usually dykes to drain the water away.
